definition: to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions
to get rid of/to put aside/to reject/to keep control/to hold (one's breath)

sentences.english: The evaluation procedure is quite simple, with each step prompted by a touchscreen.
sentences.chinese: 整个评估过程非常简单，每一步都是用触屏控制的。

sentences.english: On a touch screen, your fingers are pressing on a hard glass or plastic surface.
sentences.chinese: 触屏的触摸表面是硬玻璃或者塑料质地的。

sentences.english: If you’re not interested in touchscreens, think multiple processor cores.
sentences.chinese: 如果你对触屏了无兴趣，那么考虑下多处理器内核吧。

sentences.english: But a new type of touch screen could be less expensive and more durable.
sentences.chinese: 但是一种新的触屏可能比较便宜，而且不容易毁坏。

sentences.english: Children who have grown up with touch-screen keypads don't distinguish the difference.
sentences.chinese: 使用触屏键盘长大的这些孩子不知道两种键盘的区别。

sentences.english: Most Flash websites will need to be rewritten to support touch-based devices.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的Flash网站需要重写以支持触屏设备。

sentences.english: I think now is the time for a really good touch screen tablet.
sentences.chinese: 是出现一款真正的触屏设备的时候了。

definition: button or key (on a device)/keystroke/CL:個|个[ge4]/to press a button
